post.titolo: The ceiling of the living room
post.descrizione: Typical of Venetian culture is the tripartition of the ceiling. The three spaces were dedicated to the intervention of the Roman Francesco Ruschi, the French Daniel Van Den Dick and the Paduan Alessandro Varotari. However, the only canvas that has kept its original position is that of the Paduan artist, entitled "Gloria di casa Selvatico wins Time". The octagonal canvas presents a great wealth of colors: the background is characterized by a blue sky turquoise typical of Padovanino with a radiant blond sun. The central figure of the composition is a girl who sits on the world with a crescent of moon in her right hand and the sun in her left. The star is humanised, it has a face that looks the girl is dreaming and in love In the lower part of the work there are two cupids holding the coat of arms of the Selvatico family in their hands A last putto is located further to the right and points to a snake, symbol of immortality.
